item.title: Romance of the Three Kingdoms 8 Remake: Destiny and Strategy Expansion Pack launches January 29, 2026 worldwide
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Turning Points, Gems, new events, Chinese voice-overs, and more.

Romance of the Three Kingdoms 8 Remake: Destiny and Strategy Expansion Pack, previously reported as Romance of the Three Kingdoms 8 Remake with Power-Up Kit, will launch for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on January 29, 2026 worldwide, publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Kou Shibusawa announced.

In Japan, the game will be available in the following editions:

  • For Those Who Do Not Own Romance of the Three Kingdoms 8 Remake
    • Physical and Digital
      • Standard – 10,780 yen (PS5, PS4, Switch) / 11,880 yen (PC)
      • “Treasure Box” Limited Edition – 17,600 yen (PS5, PS4, Switch) / 18,700 yen (PC)
        • Includes a copy of the game, a 500-piece mosaic art jigsaw puzzle, a set of two A4 clear files, a soundtrack CD, and the bonus fictional scenario “The Divided Age.”
  • For Those Who Do Own Romance of the Three Kingdoms 8 Remake
    • Physical and Digital
      • Downloadable Content “Destiny and Strategy Expansion Pack” – 5,280 yen (PC)
      • Downloadable Content “Destiny and Strategy Expansion Pack” “Treasure Box” Limited Edition – 12,100 yen (PC)
        • Includes the downloadable content “Destiny and Strategy Expansion Pack,” a 500-piece mosaic art jigsaw puzzle, a set of two A4 clear files, a soundtrack CD, and the bonus fictional scenario “The Divided Age.”
    • Digital
      • Downloadable Content “Destiny and Strategy Expansion Pack” – 4,730 yen (PS5, PS4, Switch)

In the west, Romance of the Three Kingdoms 8 Remake: Destiny and Strategy Expansion Pack will be available as downloadable content for Romance of the Three Kingdoms 8 Remake. It is currently unclear whether a digital bundle or physical release is planned, though the latter is unlikely considering the base game was only released digitally in the west.

Here is an overview of the new content, via its Steam page:

About

A boundless Three Kingdoms experience.

To celebrate the series’ 40th anniversary, we have improved the quality of and added new content to the “Play as All Officers” feature of Romance of the Three Kingdoms 8 Remake, which allows you to play as any officer in the world of the Three Kingdoms. Enjoy the game to the fullest with new elements like Turning Points and Gems, new events, and a new Chinese voice option.

Key Features

  • Turmoil and Tension Abound in the New Turning Point System – Experience new gameplay through various Turning Points, each with their own far-reaching effects. You will need to predict which Turning Points are likely to occur and employ appropriate strategies to work alongside or counter them.
  • Gems Based on Status and Reputation Result in a Variety of Play Styles – Enable a range of possible actions through different Gem types based on your current status. You will have to consider each Gem’s effects to decide which to unlock and use for your officer’s development.
  • New Features and Data Make It Easier to Customize Your Play Experience – We have added the highly requested Chinese voice option and made all cutscenes fully voiced. We have also enhanced the data for Traits, historical events, and Official Titles, and have implemented in-game editing and Registered Specialties features.

item.title: Gekisou! BAND STAR launches December 11 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Band rhythm game from MAGES. dated.

Rhythm game Gekisou! BAND STAR will launch for Switch on December 11 in Japan for 6,380 yen, publisher MAGES> and developer Digital Works Entertainment announced.

The game will feature the following 30 songs:

  • Hit Songs by Top Artists, Band Style (25 songs)
    • “Everyday, Kachuusha” by AKB48
    • “Flying Get” by AKB48
    • “Heavy Rotation” by AKB48
    • “Aitakatta” by AKB48
    • “Koi Suru Fortune Cookie” by AKB48
    • “Bling-Bang-Bang-Born” by Creepy Nuts
    • “Otonoke” by Creepy Nuts
    • “Ikuokukonen” by Creepy Nuts
    • “RAGE OF DUST” by Spyair
    • “Some Like It Hot!!” by Spyair
    • “Watch me!” by YOASOBI
    • “Idol” by YOASOBI
    • “Kaibutsu” by YOASOBI
    • “Gunjou” by YOASOBI
    • “The Blessing” by YOASOBI
    • “Yoru ni Kakeru” by YOASOBI
    • “The Brave” by YOASOBI
    • “Blue Bird” by Ikimono-gakari
    • “Koyoi no Tsuki no Youni” by Elephant Kashimashi
    • “Fatal” by GEMN
    • “When the Weak Go Marching In” by Tatsuya Kitani
    • “Where Our Blue Is” by Tatsuya Kitani
    • “Apollo” by Porno Graffitti
    • “FREEDOM” by Takanori Nishikawa
    • “Mela!” by Ryokuoushoku Shakai
  • Classic Tunes, Band Style (five songs)
    • “Orpheus in the Underworld”
    • “Hungarian Dance No.5”
    • “Ride of the Valkyries”
    • “Light Cavalry”
    • “Turkish March”

All songs will be playable in “Solo Mode” or “Multi Mode.” In Solo Mode, you can choose from guitar, boss, keyboard, or drums, and play offline with the difficulty of your choosing. The remaining instruments will be played by the CPU, allowing you to enjoy a full band session even when playing alone. In Multi Mode, up to four players can play together either locally or online, with each player requiring a system and copy of the game when played locally.

Additionally, with “Arrange Mode,” you can create 120,000 different song arrangements with simple controls, as well as adjust the note difficulty during gameplay. “Easy Arrange” mode allows you to easily create arrangements by selecting options like genre, tempo, and difficulty, while more detailed customization allows you to change individual note patterns, tones, and effect settings.

The game also features unlockable rewards and achievements, including playable songs, and customizations for band members and the lobby screen background. There are over 200 items to unlock, including outfits, hairstyles, hats, instruments, accessories, and lobby backgrounds.

item.title: Sony Interactive Entertainment and Giant Squid trademark Sword of the Sea in Europe
item.content:encoded:
Adventure game already released for PlayStation 5 and PC.

Both Sony Interactive Entertainment and Giant Squid filed a trademark for “Sword of the Sea” in Europe on October 7. The two companies are each listed as an owner of the trademark.

Sword of the Sea is an atmospheric adventure game released for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on August 19. It was available via the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog at launch, but it was not published or developed by Sony Interactive Entertainment.

Giant Squid, the game’s developer, is an independent studio based in California, which raises questions about the co-ownership of the trademark.

One possible scenario is that Sony Interactive Entertainment acquired the Sword of the Sea intellectual property from Giant Squid. Another is that Sony Interactive Entertainment acquired the studio itself.

Gematsu has reached out to both Sony Interactive Entertainment and Giant Squid for comment, and will update this story with any response.
